_metadata.name: STE-100 Simplified Technical English Dictionary
_metadata.description: Approved words and rules based on ASD-STE100 specification

approved_verbs.description: Approved verbs with their approved meanings. Only use in the approved sense.

adjust: to move to a correct position
become: to change to a different condition
calculate: to find a value by mathematics
close: to move to a closed position
compare: to examine for differences or similarities
cut: to divide with a sharp tool
flow: to move as a liquid or gas
flush: to clean by running liquid through
identify: to find and show which one
land: to come down to the ground
mark: to put a visible sign on
measure: to find the size, quantity, or degree
open: to move to an open position
pump: to move fluid with a pump
read: to look at and understand written words
reset: to put back to original condition
speak: to use the voice to say words

approved_adjectives.description: Approved adjectives for use in technical documentation

unapproved_words.description: Common words to avoid with their approved alternatives

rules.title: Keep sentences short
rules.description: Maximum 20 words for procedural sentences, 25 words for descriptive sentences

rules.title: Use approved words only
rules.description: Use only approved words from the dictionary. Technical names are permitted.

rules.title: Use the approved meaning
rules.description: Each approved word has specific approved meanings. Use only those meanings.

rules.title: Use active voice
rules.description: Write in active voice. Use passive voice only when the doer is not important.

rules.title: Use articles
rules.description: Always use articles (the, a, an) where appropriate.

rules.title: Use simple verb tenses
rules.description: Use present tense and past tense. Avoid continuous tenses.

rules.title: Use the infinitive form after verbs
rules.description: Example: 'Start the pump to supply fuel' not 'Start the pump for supplying fuel'

rules.title: Use a verb for instructions
rules.description: Start instructions with a verb in the imperative form.

rules.title: Write one instruction per sentence
rules.description: Do not combine multiple instructions in one sentence.

rules.title: Use connecting words to show logic
Do not omit parts of the sentence
rules.description: Include all necessary parts: subject, verb, object.

rules.title: Use the same word for the same thing
rules.description: Be consistent with terminology throughout the document.

rules.title: Use words as the approved part of speech
rules.description: Only use words as their approved grammatical type.

technical_terms.description: Technical names - domain-specific terms allowed per STE-100 (Section 1.5). These are terms that have no approved alternative in the technical vocabulary.
